question: Question_05_(b)
statement:
Use the method of Lagrange multipliers to find the maximum and minimum
values of

\begin{align*}\displaystyle
f(x,y) = 6y - y^3 - 3x^2 y\end{align*}

on the circle

\begin{align*}\displaystyle
x^2 + y^2 = 4\end{align*}

A solution that does not use the method of Lagrange multipliers will
receive no credit, even if the answer is correct.
